meanings.definition: Capable of being projected or estimated.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used a projectable image to explain the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The projectable screen displayed the information clearly.
meanings.sent3: The projectable data made the students' eyes widen in surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her projectable skills in math made her a star student.
meanings.sent5: The projectable graph made understanding the concept much easier.

meanings.definition: Able to be shown or displayed.
meanings.sent1: The projectable map helped the travelers find their way.
meanings.sent2: The projectable movie was enjoyed by all the audience.
meanings.sent3: The projectable art on the wall brightened up the room.
meanings.sent4: Her projectable talent in painting amazed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The projectable photos brought back fond memories for the family.

meanings.definition: Likely to succeed or be realized in the future.
meanings.sent1: His projectable plan for the business impressed the investors.
meanings.sent2: The projectable idea sparked excitement among the team.
meanings.sent3: The projectable dream of traveling the world kept her motivated.
meanings.sent4: Her projectable goals drove her to work hard every day.
meanings.sent5: The projectable vision of a better future inspired everyone in the community.
